Government soldiers encountered New People's Army rebels at Barangay Puray, Rodriguez town, Rizal on March 2. Two Dumagat tribe members were allegedly killed in the crossfire.

A senior education official in Lanao del Sur province was killed in a gun attack in Parang town, Maguindanao on March 3 afternoon. There are indications that the incident could be related either to an old grudge or a clan war involving the victim's family.
On 3 March 2017, a grenade exploded outside the gate of a civilian's home in Barangay Silanga, Catbalogan city shortly after a first explosion in the city. No one was hurt in the second explosion.

03 March. Government troops of the 32nd Infantry Battalion encountered about 150 Abu Sayyaf militants at Barangay Taglibi, Patikul town, Sulu on March 3. Government troops were supported by airstrike and ground artillery. Several soldiers were wounded and at least 10 militants reportedly killed.
A farmer was allegedly tortured by government soldiers and forced admit that he was bringing rice for the communist rebels at Sitio Tagada, Barangay Maragatas, Lupon town, Davao Oriental on March 3.

notes: A civilian was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants at San Juan, Ilocos Sur on 03 Mar 17. The incident is being investigated if it is related to drugs.
A barangay chairman of Barangay 200, Tondo was shot dead in an ambush by unidentified armed men in Tondo on March 3. The motive for the killing is unclear.
An improvised explosive device hurt two minors in Catbalogan city, Samar on March 3. The IED was planted by unidentified men.
Government troops encountered fleeing Abu Sayyaf militants at Barangay Kan Ague, Patikul area on March 3.

Militant groups held a protest assumed in Intramuros, Manila on March 3 to push the Labor Department to immediately sign the Department Order that will eradicate all forms of contractualization and strictly implement workers' regularization.

Security measures: On March 6, Philippines National Police launched the nationwide Oplan Tokhang 2, also known as Project Double Barrel: Reloaded, an aggressive anti-drug operation which saw the raiding of 81,603 houses. Up to 391,236 people were visited by authorities by April 7.

From 13-16 March, government forces conducted an offensive against Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Datu Salibo town area, Maguindanao province. The series of air strikes and ground combat operations cleared Barangays Andavit, Gawang and Tee from BIFF occupation. According to intelligence sources, 21 militants were killed and 26 others and a government soldier were wounded. BIFF denies any losses. (21 fatalities divided across 12 events.)

Government bombing operations that targeted suspected communist lairs near Barangay Lat-ey area, Malibcong, Abra on March 15 or March 16. Villagers counted 14 explosions. The government did not verify the reports. No casualties reported.

Government troops encountered New People's Army rebels twice at Sitio Maglahos, Barangay PM Sobrecary, Caraga area, Davao Oriental on March 23. Air Force helicopters provided air support. Two soldiers were wounded in the first encounter and one soldier was killed in the second.
Government troops encountered New People's Army rebels at Barangay Cayaga, San Fernando in Bukidnon on March 23. No casualties reported.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf militants kidnapped two Filipino men from a cargo boat off Sibago Island in Basilan province on March 23.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Tempo; ABS CBN
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Trento, Agusan del Sur on 23 Mar 2017.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: The Army's 26th Infantry Battalion encountered New People's Army (NPA) rebels at Sitio Mandanao, Barangay Bunucayan, Loreto town, Agusan del Sur on March 26, killing two rebels and a government militiamen.

source: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; Bulatlat; Davao Today
notes: A farmer activist and Board Director of the Golden Valley Banana Planters Association (GVPBA) was shot dead by masked men in his house in Barangay Anitapan area, Mabini, Davao de Oro on 23 Mar 2017. Residents alleged that the gunmen were soldiers who accused the farmer activist of being an NPA rebel.

Hundreds of New People's Army guerrillas occupied the upland village of Camutan, Antipas town, North Cotabato on March 23 morning, forcing hundreds of villagers to leave at gunpoint. NPAs looted houses, collected money from villagers and took their farm animals. They allegedly also took 70 hostages which were later released.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Poblacion 2, Alfonso town in Cavite over the weekend preceding March 23. His associate was also arrested.

Government troops encountered New People's Army rebels during a joint police and military operation at Barangay Camutan, Antipas, North Cotabato on March 23 after NPA rebels reportedly took over the village and forced civilians to evacuate. No casualties reported.
23 March or 24 March. Government troops encountered Abu Sayyaf militants in the wider Tuburan town area, Basilan on March 23 or March 24, killing one militant.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Around 50 New People's Army rebels attacked a paramilitary detachment at Barangay Tablu, Tampakan, South Cotabato leading to an intense firefight between soldiers and NPA on March 24. The military estimated that about six to 10 rebels were killed during aerial bombardment.

24 March. Government troops clashed with New People's Army rebels during clearing operations at Barangay Camutan, Antipas, North Cotabato on March 24 after NPA rebels reportedly stormed the village on March 23. No casualties reported.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Rosario, Cavite on 24 Mar 2017.

source: Manila Bulletin; Foundation for Media Alternatives

Six people were killed in intermittent clashes between two heavily-armed Moro clans (Cua and Matalam families) fighting for control of patches of arable land at Barangay General Luna, Carmen town, North Cotabato on March 25 and March 26.
Armed men believed to be NPA rebels robbed at gunpoint workers of RD Interior Construction stationed at the field office of an ongoing bridge project in Cabagan town in Isabela on March 25.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified man at Barangay Mahabang Dahilig, Lemery town, Batangas on March 25 or March 26.

25 March. Naval forces encountered suspected Abu Sayyaf militants while conducting a maritime blockade off the coast of Al-Barka area on March 25. Soldiers seized two boats and weapons and killed one militant. They also rescued a Filipino hostage victim.
At least four people have been killed and 23 others injured when a suspect threw a grenade into a bakery shop in Jolo, Sulu on March 25

source: ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; House of Representatives (Philippines)

Government troops encountered unidentified militants at Mt. Matangal, Basilan on March 26. No casualties reported.

Six people were killed in intermittent clashes between two heavily-armed Moro clans (Cua and Matalam families) fighting for control of patches of arable land at Barangay General Luna, Carmen town, North Cotabato on March 25 and March 26. Followers of both sides are locked since late Sunday in a standoff with a peacekeeping contingent trying to end the conflict.

Around 30 students of the Tarlac National High School, backed up by militant organizations, staged a protest demonstration on March 27 over a domestic issue in the school.

Gunmen shot dead a Muslim cleric who was active in helping push the government's anti-narcotics campaign on his way home to Barangay Bagua III, Cotabato City on March 29.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: New People's Army rebels attacked a detachment of the Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (Cafgu) at Barangay 1-A, Motiong town, Samar on March 30. No casualties reported.
Defusal: An improvised explosive device was found inside a Manila-bound passenger bus in Dasmarinas City in Cavite province on March 30.

More than 150 New People's Army rebels attacked a military detachment at Barangay Geparayan, Silvino Lobos area, Northern Samar on March 30, seizing high-powered firearms and injuring four civilians in the crossfire. The 8th Infantry Division launched pursuit operations.

The Army entered a peasant community in Sitio Traktora, Bagong Silang, Sipocot, Camarines Sur attacking civilians. Renel Mirabelesa, a local resident, was killed, while other residents were severely wounded.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Journal (Philippines)
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Malolos, Bulacan on 30 Mar 2017.

The Army troops of the 28th and 66th Infantry Battalion encountered New People's Army rebels from the Pulang Bagani Company 6 at Tagbionga, Mati City, Davao Oriental on March 30. Two soldiers were hurt and one rebel was killed.

Soldiers of the 28th and 66th Infantry Battalions killed a peasant resident of Tagbinonga, Mati City, Davao Oriental, assuming his affiliation with the New People's Army (NPA). The victim's alleged links to the NPA were disputed by his family.

actor1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
notes: A soldier of the Army's 38th Infantry Battalion was wounded when unidentified elements set off a powerful bomb along the national highway in the village of Labu-Labu, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao on March 30. The authorities suspected members of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters could be behind the attack.
Government troops encountered New People's Army rebels near Barangay Benli area, Bulalacao town, Oriental Mindoro on March 30, killing 5 rebels and a soldier.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Scout Ranger
notes: Soldiers from the Task Group Panther and 4th Scout Ranger Company encountered a criminal gang supplying wagons to Abu Sayyaf in a 20-minute gunfight in the wider Omar tow area, Sulu on March 30.
Government troops encountered New People's Army rebels at Barangay Lumutan, General Nakar town, Quezon province on March 30, killing 2 soldiers and 10 rebels and injuring 2 more soldiers.
A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified gunman at Silay, Negros Occidental on 30 Mar 2017.

A team of soldiers under the 40th Infantry Battalion on a security patrol encountered Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) on the borders of in Barangay Timbangan area, Shariff Aguak town and Barangay Nabundas, Shariff Saydona early on March 31. Two soldiers were slightly injured.
2 soldiers of the 40th IB were wounded in an IED attack followed by gunfire from Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) near the town centre in Mamasapano, Maguindanao on March 31.
A drug suspect was shot at and wounded in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified men on Magat Bridge in Barangay Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela on March 31.
The Army's 83rd IB encountered suspected New People's Army (NPA) members in Bololo village, Guinobatan, Albay on March 31. No casualties occurred.

A soldier was wounded in an encounter between government troops and NPA rebels at the boundaries of Barangays Osmena, Lakandula and Cuenco area, Las Navas town, Northern Samar on March 31 morning. The military claimed that local civilians saw retreating NPA rebels carrying three dead comrades and five others who were wounded.
